page.title: 15HOUSING IN BISHOP BURTON
page.content: Bishop Burton is a small picturesque village with a total of 96 dwellings (the population being 370, 73 of which are old age pensioners). In the past a large proportion of houses were rented but now many have been sold because of the high prices they can command from outsiders willing to commute to the nearby towns to work. There are approximately 30 council houses, originally built for farmworkers, but which are now mainly occupied by old age pensioners who have lived all their lives in the village; only three farmworkers remain. Many council houses have been bought by their tenants. There are 4 to 6 special pensioners houses called Alms houses run by The Hamsby Committee.
